intro: Thenardia chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapas thenardia, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America, particularly found in the humid lowland forests of Chiapas, Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insect species, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystem.
